trans-unit.source: Provides data for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent"></xref> event that is raised when you click on a selected control or a designer region in a selected control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by the designer host for certain actions on a control on the design surface.
For example, an event is raised when you click a selected control or a designer region in a selected control on the design surface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event.

When you click a selected control or a designer region of a selected control at design time, the designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event type, and then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object indicates that you clicked a designer region, the default delegate in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class passes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method.

Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method to process events that are raised when you click a control in the design host.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Region%2A> property represents the control designer region that the event applies to, if any.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Location%2A> property represents the location on the design surface that was clicked.
For more information about events and delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified region and location.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> delegate method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor to initialize a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object for use with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object.

When you click a control region at design time, the designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event type, and then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object.
The designer region that was clicked; used to initialize the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Region"></xref>.
The location that was clicked, relative to the upper left corner of the region; used to initialize the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Location"></xref>.
Gets the location within the control that was clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Location%2A> property contains the coordinates that identify where you clicked, relative to the upper left corner of the region.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Location%2A> property is initialized by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> identifying the location within the region that was clicked.
Gets the designer region that was clicked, if any.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Region%2A> property represents the control designer region that was clicked, if any.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Region%2A> property is initialized by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> that the click event applies to, or `null` if no region was clicked.
